Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.datastorage

Class DataContainer

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.datastorage.BaseContainer
org.opentdk.api.datastorage.DataContainer
public class DataContainer
extends BaseContainer
Class used to store data from different sources at runtime of an application in an ArrayList. The source data needs to be in a structured format, and keys can be assigned to the coordinates of the fields. In general, the keys are column- or row-headers, that will be assigned to a column- or row-index within the ArrayList.
The class provides methods for putting data from different sources into an instance of DataContainer, as well as getter and setter methods, for reading data from, and writing data into the object.
This will allow to build applications with standardized data interface with minimum maintenance effort in case that the data source changes.
Author:
LK Test Solutions GmbH

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    DataContainer()
    Default constructor for the specific DataContainer.
    DataContainer​(InputStream inStream)
    Constructor that is called when no input file exists and the container for the specific data format also accepts InputStream for the data.
    e.g.: An application dynamically receives data by calling RestAPI Service Requests and the XML responses will be passed to the BaseDispatcher that creates an XMLDataContainer for parsing the XML response.

    Constructor that is called, when a DataContainer shall be copied.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer()
      Default constructor for the specific DataContainer.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String[] headers)
      Constructor that is called, when creating a new instance by just committing the data container column headers. Used when the data gets loaded into the container afterwards, but the structure is known. The semicolon is used as column separator.
      Parameters:
      headers - The column headers as array of type string.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String srcFile)
      Constructor that is called, when creating a new instance with an ASCII File of structured data.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String srcFile, Filter fltr)
      Constructor that is called with the source file to store data from and a filter to decide if part of the data should be ignored. The file string must be valid, the filter may be null.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      fltr - The filter object to decide which data should be ignored.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String srcFile, String delimiter, Filter fltr)
      Constructor that is called when the source file, the column delimiter and the filter is known.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      delimiter - The delimiter to separate the stored data.
      fltr - The filter object to decide which data should be ignored.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String srcFile, String delimiter)
      Constructor that is called when the source file, the column delimiter and the filter is known.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      delimiter - The delimiter to separate the stored data.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String srcFile, String delimiter, int headerIndex, Filter fltr)
      Constructor that is called when the source file, the column delimiter, the header index and the filter is known.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      delimiter - The delimiter to separate the stored data.
      headerIndex - TODO description
      fltr - A Filter object to define which data should be ignored. If it is null no filter gets used.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String srcFile, String delimiter, int headerIndex)
      Constructor that is called when creating a new instance with column separated file.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      delimiter - Character(s) that are used as delimiter within the file
      headerIndex - TODO description

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String srcFile, String delimiter, String[] headers)
      Constructor that is called when the source file, the data delimiter and the column header are known.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      delimiter - Character(s) that are used as delimiter within the file
      headers - The column header as string array.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String srcFile, String delimiter, BaseContainer.EHeader srcHeader)
      Constructor that is called when the source file, the data delimiter and the header orientation are known.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      delimiter - Character(s) that are used as delimiter within the file
      srcHeader - The header orientation (column or row header)

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(String srcFile, String delimiter, int headerIndex, String[] headers, Filter fltr)
      Constructor that is called when the source file, the data delimiter, the header orientation, the header index, the header names and the filter are known.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      delimiter - Character(s) that are used as delimiter within the file
      headerIndex - TODO description
      headers - The column header as string array.
      fltr - A Filter object to define which data should be ignored. If it is null no filter gets used.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(InputStream inStream)
      Constructor that is called when no input file exists and the container for the specific data format also accepts InputStream for the data.
      e.g.: An application dynamically receives data by calling RestAPI Service Requests and the XML responses will be passed to the BaseDispatcher that creates an XMLDataContainer for parsing the XML response.

       InputStream stream = new ByteArrayInputStream(QCDesignStep_Response.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
 EQCStepField.setDataContainer(EQCStepField.class, stream);
 String[] stepNames = EDesignSteps.STEP_NAME.getValues();
 String[] stepDescriptions = EDesignSteps.STEP_DESCRIPTION.getValues();
 String[] stepExpected = EDesignSteps.STEP_EXPECTED.getValues();
      Parameters:
      inStream - Object of type InputStream

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(ResultSet rs)
      Constructor that is called, when importing data from a database request to the container. No filter will be used and the column delimiter for the imported data is the semicolon.
      Parameters:
      rs - The result of the database request.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(ResultSet rs, Filter fltr)
      Constructor that is called, when importing data from a database request to the container with the possibility to filter the data before it gets imported. The column delimiter of the imported data is the semicolon.
      Parameters:
      rs - The result of the database request.
      fltr - A Filter object to define which data should be ignored. If it is null no filter gets used.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(ResultSet rs, Filter fltr, String colDelimiter)
      Constructor that is called, when importing data from a database request to the container with the possibility to filter the data before it gets imported and define a column delimiter for the imported data.
      Parameters:
      rs - The result of the database request.
      fltr - A Filter object to define which data should be ignored. If it is null no filter gets used.
      colDelimiter - Possibility to define a column delimiter for the imported table data like semicolon.

    • DataContainer

      public DataContainer​(DataContainer dc, int[] headerIndices)
      Constructor that is called, when a DataContainer shall be copied. The copy holds only the columns with the headers specified in headerIndices.
      Parameters:
      dc - Original DataContainer from which the columns shall be copied.
      headerIndices - Headers which shall be copied to the new DataContainer

  • Method Details

    • addColumn

      public void addColumn​(String col)
      This method is designed for tabular data formats to add column names to existing DataContainer. In case the column name already exists, an suffix with the next available index will be appended to the column name.
      Parameters:
      col - Name of the column that will be added to the BaseContainer.headerNames

    • addColumn

      public void addColumn​(String col, boolean useExisting)
      This method is designed for tabular data formats to add column names to existing DataContainer. The useExisting argument specifies the behavior for existing columns with the same name. Either use the existing column or create a new column by appending a unique index to the name.
      Parameters:
      col - Name of the column that will be added to the BaseContainer.headerNames
      useExisting - Boolean value - true = if column name exist, then use the existing column; false = if column name exists, then add column name with an index suffix

    • addField

      public void addField​(String headerName, String value, Filter fltr)
      This method is designed for data formats, where single fields like tree nodes or XML tags can be addressed, instead of columns or rows with multiple values. The field will be added with name and value into parent node, which path needs to be defined by filter conditions.
      Usage sample with XMLDataContainer.addField(String, String, Filter): 
       Filter fltr = new Filter();
 fltr.addFilterRule("XPath", "/parserRules/rule[@name='Orbit']/element[@name='SELECT']", EOperator.EQUALS);
 return dataContainer.addField("StartsWith", "select[\s]*", fltr);
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the field or node that will be added.
      value - Value that will be assigned to the field or node.
      fltr - The filter object to insert the new node at the right position as demonstrated above.

    • addField

      public void addField​(String headerName, String attributeName, String attributeValue, Filter fltr)
      This method is designed for data formats, where single fields like tree nodes or XML tags can be addressed, instead of columns or rows with multiple values. The field will be added with name and an attribute into parent node, which path needs to be defined by filter conditions.
      Usage sample with XMLDataContainer.addField(String, String, String, Filter): 
       Filter fltr = new Filter();
 fltr.addFilterRule("XPath", "/parserRules/rule[@name='Orbit']", EOperator.EQUALS);
 return dataContainer.addField("element", "name", "INSERT", fltr);
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the field or node that will be added.
      attributeName - Name of the attribute that will be assigned to the field or node.
      attributeValue - Value that will be assigned to the attribute of the field or node.
      fltr - The filter object to insert the new node at the right position as demonstrated above.

    • addField

      public void addField​(String headerName, String attributeName, String oldAttrValue, String attributeValue, Filter fltr)
      This method is designed for data formats, where single fields like tree nodes or XML tags can be addressed, instead of columns or rows with multiple values. The method is reserved to add or overwrite elements within the data source. These elements can be e.g. nodes, tags or attributes of existing nodes or tags, depending on the implementation for the specific Data Container.

      Usage sample with XMLDataContainer.addField(String, String, String, String, Filter): 
       Filter fltr = new Filter();
 fltr.addFilterRule("XPath", "/parserRules/rule[@name='Orbit']", EOperator.EQUALS);
 return dataContainer.addField("element", "name", "INSERT", "INSERT INTO", fltr);
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the field or node that will be added.
      attributeName - Name of the attribute that will be assigned to the field or node.
      oldAttrValue - The attribute value that will be replaced, in case it exists.
      attributeValue - Value that will be assigned to the attribute of the field or node.
      fltr - The filter object to insert the new node at the right position as demonstrated above.

    • addRow

      public void addRow()
      Adds an empty row to the values ArrayList that is used for tabular data formats.

    • addRow

      public void addRow​(String[] row)
      Adds a string array with the row content into the BaseContainer.values ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      row - String array with the content of the row to be added

    • addRow

      public void addRow​(int rowIndex, String[] rowValues)
      Inserts a string array with the row content into the BaseContainer.values ArrayList at a specified position in this list. Shifts the row currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent row.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - index at which the specified row is to be inserted
      rowValues - String array with all row values to be inserted

    • addRows

      public void addRows​(List<String[]> rows)
      Adds one or more string arrays with the row content into the BaseContainer.values ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      rows - List of string arrays with the content of the rows to be added

    • appendData

      public void appendData​(String fileName, String columnDelimiter) throws FileNotFoundException
      This method reads data from a specified source file and appends it to the existing data within the container.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be added to the DataContainer
      columnDelimiter - The column separator to structure the data.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the committed file does not exist.

    • appendData

      public void appendData​(String fileName) throws FileNotFoundException
      This method reads data from a specified source file and appends it to the existing data within the container.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be added to the DataContainer
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the committed file does not exist.

    • appendDataContainer

      public void appendDataContainer​(DataContainer dc)
      This method checks if the headers-of the assigned DataContainer match with the headers of the current instance and appends all data of the assigned DataContainer to the values List of the DataContaner instance which is calling the method, in case the headers of both DataContainer are the same.
      Parameters:
      dc - The DataContanier which content will be appended to the current DataContainer instance.

    • deleteField

      public void deleteField​(String headerName, String attributeName, String attributeValue, Filter fltr)
      This method is designed for data formats, where single fields like tree nodes or XML tags can be addressed, instead of columns or rows with multiple values. The field matching the defined arguments will be deleted from the data source.
      Usage sample with XMLDataContainer.deleteField(String, String, String, Filter) 
       Filter fltr = new Filter();
 fltr.addFilterRule("XPath", "/parserRules/rule[@name='Orbit']", EOperator.EQUALS);
 dataContainer.deleteField("element", "name", "INSERT", fltr);
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the field or node that will be deleted.
      attributeName - Name of the attribute that is part of the field or node description.
      attributeValue - Value of the attribute that is part of the field or node description.
      fltr - The filter object to find the field or node at the right position as demonstrated above.

    • exportContainer

      public void exportContainer​(String fileName) throws IOException
      This method writes data to a existing or newly created CSV file. Useful if the current state of the container should be saved. The semicolon gets used as column separator.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      Throws:
      IOException - If any error occurred when writing to the file.

    • exportContainer

      public void exportContainer​(String fileName, String columnDelimiter) throws IOException
      This method writes data to a existing or newly created CSV file. Useful if the current state of the container should be saved. The column separator can be set.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The file path of the file to write to or to create.
      columnDelimiter - The column separator to structure the data.
      Throws:
      IOException - If any error occurred when writing to the file.

    • getAttributes

      public String[] getAttributes​(String tag, String attrName)
      A specific method for type XMLDataContainer to get the attributes of a XML tag.
      Parameters:
      tag - The name of the XML tag to refer to.
      attrName - The name of the XML attribute to refer to.
      Returns:
      An array of type string with all attributes to the committed tag.

    • getColumn

      public String[] getColumn​(int index)
      Gets the content of a column from the DataContainer instance. In order to get the columns content, it is iterated through each row saved. The column is specified with index and the content is returned as Array of type String
      Parameters:
      index - The column's index, which content is searched.
      Returns:
      The content of the specified column as Array of type String.

    • getColumn

      public String[] getColumn​(String colName)
      Gets the content of a column from the DataContainer instance. In order to get the columns content, it is iterated through each row saved. The column is specified with header name and the content is returned as Array of type String
      Parameters:
      colName - The header name of the column.
      Returns:
      The content of the specified column as Array of type String.

    • getColumn

      public String[] getColumn​(int index, Filter fltr)
      Gets filtered content of a column from the DataContainer instance. Only values of a column that match to one or more conditions. In order to get the columns content, it is iterated through each row saved. The column is specified with index and the content is returned as Array of type String.
      Parameters:
      index - The column's index, which content is searched.
      fltr - A Filter object to define which data should be ignored. If it is null no filter gets used.
      Returns:
      the content of the specified column as Array of type String.

    • getColumn

      public String[] getColumn​(String colName, Filter fltr)
      Gets filtered content of a column from the DataContainer instance. Only values of a column, that match to one or more conditions. In order to get the columns content, it is iterated through each row saved. The column is specified with column header name and the content is returned as Array of type String.
      Parameters:
      colName - The header name of the column.
      fltr - A Filter object to define which data should be ignored. If it is null no filter gets used.
      Returns:
      the content of the specified column as Array of type String.

    • getColumn

      public String[] getColumn​(String colName, int[] rowIndexes, Filter fltr)
      Gets filtered content of a column from the DataContainer instance. Only values of a column, that match to one or more conditions. In order to get the columns content, it is iterated through each row saved. The column is specified with column header name and the content is returned as Array of type String, but only if the detected rows in the column match the committed row indexes.
      Parameters:
      colName - The header name of the column.
      rowIndexes - An array of type integer that contains all row indexes that should be taken into account when searching in the column.
      fltr - A Filter object to define which data should be ignored. If it is null no filter gets used.
      Returns:
      the content of the specified column as Array of type String.

    • getColumnCount

      public int getColumnCount()
      Returns the number of columns defined within the current instance of the DataContainer.
      Returns:
      number of columns

    • getColumnsList

      public List<String[]> getColumnsList()
      Gets a List of string arrays with all column values of the DataContainer instance.
      Returns:
      Object of type List with string arrays, including all matching values of a column.

    • getColumnsList

      public List<String[]> getColumnsList​(Filter rowFilter)
      Gets a List of string arrays with all column values that match to the defined filter. The Filter defines the rules for matching rows.

      e.g. get string arrays for each column of table 'Customer' where the value of 'City' equals to 'Munich'.
      Parameters:
      rowFilter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows
      Returns:
      Object of type List with string arrays, including all matching values of a column.

    • getColumnsList

      public List<String[]> getColumnsList​(String columnHeaders, Filter rowFilter)
      Gets a List of string arrays with all column values that match to the defined filter. The Filter defines the rules for matching rows.

      e.g. get string arrays for each column of table 'Customer' where the value of 'City' equals to 'Munich'.
      Parameters:
      columnHeaders - Semicolon separated string with the column names of which the values will be returned.
      rowFilter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows.
      Returns:
      Object of type List with string arrays, including all matching values of a column.

    • getColumnsList

      public List<String[]> getColumnsList​(String[] columnHeaders, int[] rowIndexes, Filter rowFilter)
      Gets a List of string arrays with all column values that match to the defined filter. The Filter defines the rules for matching rows. Additionally it is possible to define the row indices that should be taken into account.

      e.g. get string arrays for each column of table 'Customer' where the value of 'City' equals to 'Munich'.
      Parameters:
      columnHeaders - Semicolon separated string with the column names of which the values will be returned.
      rowFilter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows.
      rowIndexes - The row numbers that should be used as search criteria.
      Returns:
      Object of type List with string arrays, including all matching values of a column.

    • getMaxLen

      public int getMaxLen​(String headerName)
      Gets the maximum length of the values corresponding to the headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the header, which can be column or row, depending on the orientation
      Returns:
      Length of the longest String corresponding to headerName

    • getRow

      public String[] getRow​(int rowIndex)
      Gets the content of a row of the container instance. The row is specified by index. If the given index is bigger than the list's size, it will return null.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - The row's index, which content is searched.
      Returns:
      The content of the specified row.

    • getRow

      public String[] getRow​(int rowIndex, String columnHeaders)
      Gets the content of a row of the container instance. The row is specified by index. If the given index is bigger than the list's size, it will return null.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - The row's index, which content is searched.
      columnHeaders - The column headers that should be taken into account, separated by semicolon. If only one header should be specified, no separation is needed of course.
      Returns:
      The content of the specified row.

    • getRow

      public String[] getRow​(int rowIndex, String[] columnHeaders)
      Gets the content of a row of the container instance. The row is specified by index. If the given index is bigger than the list's size, it will return null.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - The row's index, which content is searched.
      columnHeaders - The column headers that should be taken into account, separated by semicolon. If only one header should be specified, no separation is needed of course.
      Returns:
      The content of the specified row.

    • getRow

      public String[] getRow​(int rowIndex, String columnHeaders, Filter fltr)
      Gets the content of a row of the container instance. The row is specified by index. If the given index is bigger than the list's size, it will return null.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - The row's index, which content is searched.
      columnHeaders - The column headers that should be taken into account, separated by semicolon. If only one header should be specified, no separation is needed of course.
      fltr - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows.
      Returns:
      The content of the specified row.

    • getRowCount

      public int getRowCount()
      Returns the number of rows of the current DataContainer instance.
      Returns:
      Number of rows e.g number of lines in case of a CSV format or number of key value pairs in case of a properties file.

    • getRowsIndexes

      public int[] getRowsIndexes​(Filter filter)
      Possibility to search for integer values of the DataContainer rows.
      Parameters:
      filter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows.
      Returns:
      The numbers of the matching rows as integer array.

    • getRowsList

      public List<String[]> getRowsList()
      Returns a list with all rows stored in the DataContainer instance.
      Returns:
      list object with stored data rows.

    • getRowsList

      public List<String[]> getRowsList​(Filter rowFilter)
      Returns a list with all rows, that match to the defined rowFilter.
      Parameters:
      rowFilter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows.
      Returns:
      A list with all rows. Each row is stored in one string array.

    • getRowsList

      public List<String[]> getRowsList​(String columnHeader, Filter rowFilter)
      Returns a list of row values for defined columns that match to a defined rowFilter.
      Parameters:
      columnHeader - The header name of the column to search in.
      rowFilter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows.
      Returns:
      A list with all rows. Each row is stored in one string array.

    • getRowsList

      public List<String[]> getRowsList​(int[] rowIndexes, String[] columnHeaders, Filter rowFilter)
      Returns a list of row values for defined columns that match to a defined rowFilter.
      Parameters:
      rowIndexes - The numbers of the rows that should be taken into account.
      columnHeaders - The header name of the column to search in.
      rowFilter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows.
      Returns:
      A list with all rows. Each row is stored in one string array.

    • getValue

      public String getValue​(String headerName)
      Use the getValue method to return the first value in column addressed by headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the column header
      Returns:
      the first value in column addressed by headerName.

    • getValue

      public String getValue​(String headerName, int rowIndex)
      Use the getValue method to return a value from a field addressed by headerName of the column and index of the row.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the column header
      rowIndex - row index of the field
      Returns:
      the value as String

    • getValue

      public String getValue​(int headerIndex, int rowIndex)
      Use the getValue method to return a value from a field addressed by headerName of the column and index of the row.
      Parameters:
      headerIndex - The name of the column header
      rowIndex - row-index of the field
      Returns:
      the value as String

    • getValue

      public String getValue​(String headerName, Filter fltr)
      Use the getValue method to return a value from a field addressed by headerName of the column and prepared filter.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the column header
      fltr - A prepared Filter instance to categorize the result
      Returns:
      the value as String

    • getValue

      public String getValue​(String headerName, int rowIndex, Filter fltr)
      Use the getValuesAsList() method to search for a value by header name, row index and prepared filter.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the column header
      rowIndex - The row index. If it is unknown or not used, commit -1 to search for header name and filter
      fltr - A prepared Filter instance to categorize the result.
      Returns:
      the value as String or an empty string if no result could be found

    • getValues

      public List<String[]> getValues()
      Gets all values from the DataContainer instance directly.
      Returns:
      List of type String with all values

    • getValuesAsDistinctedList

      public List<String> getValuesAsDistinctedList​(String headerName)
      Gets a sequence of distincted values from the DataContainer instance. Depending on the header orientation, this method will retrieve the values of one row, or one column, which is defined by headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the header, which can be column or row, depending on the orientation
      Returns:
      distincted list of type String with the selected values

    • getValuesAsDoubleList

      public List<Double> getValuesAsDoubleList​(String headerName)
      Gets a sequence of numeric values from the DataContainer instance and returns them as List of Double. Depending on the header orientation, this method will retrieve the values of one row, or one column, which is defined by headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the header, which can be column or row, depending on the orientation
      Returns:
      List of type Double with all selected values

    • getValuesAsDoubleList

      public List<Double> getValuesAsDoubleList​(String headerName, Filter rowFilter)
      Gets a sequence of numeric values from the current DataContainer instance, that matches to a defined filter and returns them as a List of Double. Depending on the header orientation, this method will retrieve the values of one row, or one column, which is defined by headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the header
      rowFilter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows
      Returns:
      List of type Double with all selected values

    • getValuesAsIntList

      public List<Integer> getValuesAsIntList​(String headerName)
      Gets a sequence of numeric values from the DataContainer instance and returns them as List of integer. Depending on the header orientation, this method will retrieve the values of one row, or one column, which is defined by headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the header, which can be column or row, depending on the orientation
      Returns:
      List of type Integer with all selected values

    • getValuesAsIntList

      public List<Integer> getValuesAsIntList​(String headerName, Filter rowFilter)
      Gets a sequence of numeric values from the current DataContainer instance, that matches to a defined filter and returns them as a List of Integer. Depending on the header orientation, this method will retrieve the values of one row, or one column, which is defined by headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the header
      rowFilter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows
      Returns:
      List of type integer with all selected values

    • getValuesAsList

      public List<String> getValuesAsList​(String headerName)
      Gets a sequence of values from the DataContainer instance. Depending on the header orientation, this method will retrieve the values of one row, or one column, which is defined by headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the header, which can be column or row, depending on the orientation
      Returns:
      List of type String with all selected values

    • getValuesAsList

      public List<String> getValuesAsList​(String headerName, Filter rowFilter)
      Gets a sequence of values from the current DataContainer instance, that matches to a defined filter. Depending on the header orientation, this method will retrieve the values of one row, or one column, which is defined by headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the header
      rowFilter - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows
      Returns:
      List of type String with all selected values

    • getValuesAsList

      public List<String> getValuesAsList​(String headerName, int[] rowIndexes, Filter fltr)
      Gets a sequence of values from the current DataContainer instance, that matches to a defined filter and defined row indexes. Depending on the header orientation, this method will retrieve the values of one row, or one column, which is defined by headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the header
      rowIndexes - int array with index numbers of the rows that will be retrieved
      fltr - Object of type Filter which defines rules for matching rows
      Returns:
      List of type String with all selected values

    • getValuesAsString

      public String getValuesAsString()
      Gets a representation of all values within the DataContainer. Columns will be separated by the associated or default column delimiter, rows by a new line.
      Returns:
      String with the complete content of the DataContainer

    • mergeRows

      public void mergeRows​(int rowIndex, String[] newValues)
      Compares the row at committed index with the committed string array. If one of the still existing row values is null or empty, it gets replaced by the value from the new array.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - row number to identify the row that should be merged
      newValues - the new data as string array

    • readData

      public void readData()
      If the DataContainer initialization and the data import needs to be done separately, this method can be used. This method requires that the data source is known by the specific DataContainer, e.g. a valid source file is assigned to the BaseContainer.fileName property.

    • readData

      public void readData​(String fileName)
      If the DataContainer initialization and the data import needs to be done separately, this method can be used.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer

    • readData

      public void readData​(Filter fltr)
      If the DataContainer initialization and the data import needs to be done separately, this method can be used. This method requires that the data source is known by the specific DataContainer, e.g. a valid source file is assigned to the BaseContainer.fileName property.
      Parameters:
      fltr - A Filter object to define which data should be ignored. If it is null no filter gets used.

    • readData

      public void readData​(String fileName, Filter fltr)
      If the DataContainer initialization and the data import needs to be done separately, this method can be used.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Full path and name of the source file, from which the data will be loaded into DataContainer
      fltr - A Filter object to define which data should be ignored. If it is null no filter gets used.

    • setColumn

      public void setColumn​(String headerName, String[] columnValues)
      Sets a column in the DataContainer instance with the specified new content. If the new column is bigger than the old one, new rows with empty values will be added.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the column. Existing column will be overwritten and non-existing column will be created.
      columnValues - The values for the column as string array.

    • setColumn

      public void setColumn​(String headerName, List<String> columnValues)
      Sets a column in the DataContainer instance with the specified new content. If the new column is bigger than the old one, new rows with empty values will be added.
      Parameters:
      headerName - The name of the column. Existing column will be overwritten and non-existing column will be created.
      columnValues - The values for the column as List of strings.

    • setRow

      public void setRow​(int rowIndex, String[] rowValues)
      Replaces the row at the committed index with the data of the committed string array.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - row number to identify the row that should be replaced
      rowValues - the new data as string array

    • setValue

      public void setValue​(String headerName, String value)
      Sets content to the first field of a sequence defined by header name with a specified value. The existing content of that field will be overwritten.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the sequence header
      value - Value as String that will be set to the field

    • setValue

      public void setValue​(String headerName, int index, String value)
      Sets content of a defined field by header name and index with a specified value. The existing content of that field will be overwritten. If a header does not exist, it will be created by shifting all existing values one position backward and setting the new one at the first position.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the sequence header
      index - Index of the field within the DataSet
      value - Value as String that will be set to the field

    • setValue

      public void setValue​(String headerName, String value, Filter fltr)
      Sets content of a defined field by header name and filter with a specified value. The existing content of the field within the first matching dataset will be overwritten. If a header does not exist, it will be created by shifting all existing values one position backward and setting the new one at the first position.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the sequence header
      value - Value as String that will be set to the field
      fltr - Filter for selection of the target dataset (row or column)

    • setValue

      public void setValue​(String headerName, int index, String value, Filter fltr)
      Sets content of a defined field by header name, index and filter with a specified value. The existing content of the field within the dataset will be overwritten. If a header does not exist, it will be created by shifting all existing values one position backward and setting the new one at the first position.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the sequence header
      index - zero based index that defines the position of the field in case that multiple fields were found
      value - Value as String that will be set to the field
      fltr - Filter for selection of the target dataset (row or column)

    • setValues

      public void setValues​(String headerName, String value, Filter fltr)
      Sets content of the first matching field defined by header name and filter with a specified value. The existing content of the field within the dataset will be overwritten. If a header does not exist, it will be created by shifting all existing values one position backward and setting the new one at the first position.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the sequence header
      value - Value as String that will be set to the field
      fltr - Filter for selection of the target dataset (row or column)

    • setValues

      public void setValues​(String headerName, String value, Filter fltr, Boolean allOccurences)

    • setValues

      public void setValues​(String headerName, int[] indexes, String value, Filter fltr)
      Sets content of multiple fields by header name, index and filter with a specified value. The existing content of the fields within the dataset will be overwritten. If a header does not exist, it will be created by shifting all existing values one position backward and setting the new one at the first position.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the sequence header
      indexes - Array with indexes, defining the position of all fields which will be overwritten
      value - Value as String that will be set to the field
      fltr - Filter for selection of the target dataset (row or column)

    • writeData

      public void writeData​(String srcFile)
      Adapt to the specific data container when the caller of the DataContainer wants to save the changes to the configuration output file.
      Parameters:
      srcFile - The path to the source file.
